Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower in faded added white outline and added red centre; top of rim glazed; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The number '25' is written in pencil and crossed out on the exterior surface. Kantharoi Type B1 have lotus flowers and lotus buds on the interior (Williams 1983, 169). Many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim and several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983.
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 169, no. 185)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 731, no. 910)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1707) (phase 2)
